name: Unrepentant - Untimely Forcing The Stillborn To Walk
description: 1. Unrepentant Heretic 2. On The Other Side Of Cold 3. Piercing The Eye Of Zeal 4. The Futile Gauntlet 5. Of Ubiquitous Judgement 6. Of Ubiquitous Judgement (2005 demo) Released on June 15, 2007. Hand-numbered to 99 copies. This recording is a representation of the first six months of the projects existence. Packaged with black & white artwork, lyrics printed on inverse, in a slim-dvd case. The addition of the 'bonus' track is an attempt to demonstrate the dynamic of context, progressively, on an even more retrospective level. The point being that the music created under the Unrepentant name resists definition and convention. I stand by this recording as proof that perseverance transcends time. This is where the story begins... Listen to Unrepentant at: www.myspace.com/unrepentantmusic

name: Unrepentant - Transcending Heresy, Vol. I (Unlimited)
description: 1. Unrepentant Heretic (4:21) 2. Plague In The Eyes Of Gorgon (8:28) 3. I Am The Minotaur (3:56) Total playing time: 16:47 This version is exactly like the limited one (Sold out!), with the exception of the packaging (printed insert in plastic sleeve), different cover art, and sharpied cd-r. This three-track demo contains one song from the previous e.p. as well as two demo-draft versions of songs to be released on the forthcoming, full-length album. Listen to Unrepentant at: www.myspace.com/unrepentantmusic

name: Unrepentant - Euphoric Nascent Absentia
description: 1. To Each, Their Own Hell (7:00, Black Metal) 2. Anguish, Cult Of Futility (6:00, Noise/Ambient) 3. In Vain, It Ends... (3:02, Noise/Ambient) (Total Length: 16:02) Hand-numbered to 66 copies. A deviation from the typical Unrepentant sound, this release explores some experimental styles that I have since delegated to my Fleshanchor project. There is a Suicidal/Depressive Blackmetal track, and two noise/ambient tracks with the theme of Futility. The cd comes inside a clear plastic sleeve with a black&white 4-panel insert with art, lyrics, and trademark Unrepentant Music red ink seal. Listen to Unrepentant at: www.myspace.com/unrepentantmusic

name: Unrepentant - Transcending Heresy, Vol. II (Limited Version)
description: 1.) The Obdurate Benevolence Of Capricious Filth (Alt. Vocal-Draft) 2.) To Be, I Become (Early Draft) 3.) Where Serpents Are Forged (Early Draft) 4.) The Stranger (Early Draft) 5.) Your Time Is Not Now (Early Draft) Unnecessary bonus “tracks” from 2003: 6.) Stop Stealing From Meshuggah 7.) Lunatic Tribute 1 - No 8.) Lunatic Tribute 2 - Retribution 9.) Ancient Needs More Solos 10.) Pretentious Outro. Limited to 50 copies. This is not a new 'album', but a compilation series of samples, drafts, experiments, and unreleased versions of past and future tracks, mostly Unrepentant, but also other UM projects, and some random other stuff for no reason other than I felt like including it. Packaged in a hand-made, origami-style case with custom red ink seal. Listen to Unrepentant at: www.myspace.com/unrepentantmusic

name: Notus Inlatinus - The Impaler Of Worlds
description:
1. Ritual I - Magnum Opus Notus Inlatinus
2. Ritual II - Subsannatio Quod Malum Gelu Obscurum
3. Ritual III - Meus Odium Vestri Nex
4. Ritual IV - Orior Oriri Ortust

Released on February 26, 2009.
Limited to 50 copies.

Lord Notus: Guitars & Wretched Screams
General Pseudonymus: Drums & Backing Wails

This is the first time that I have decided to conspire with another band too practice my DIY production skills.  In my opinion, they sound like basically Darkthrone if they were French.  Pure evil, raging, cult minimalism, right to the fucking point.  It's all about SATAN and HATE.  I have absolutely no idea what they are screaming/vomiting on these recordings, but its painfully obvious they mean it.  The following is quoted from cd insert and is a better explanation:
"Thirteen months ago (12/07) I received a very brief letter, postmarked from France, stating that its author was interested in releasing a recording of “hateful blackmetal art” on my Unrepentant Music DIY Label.  Intrigued that such a foreign artist would even know of this obscure label, no less consider it worthy to produce  and release their music, a request was sent for more information about what this mysterious band had in mind, as well as for some audio samples.  Approximately one month later this recording arrived, along with some crude artwork, design instructions, and a “Letter Of Intent” from the band.  I can tell you nothing more about this project other than that it was recorded “during the darkest days of winter 2005 anno satanas on analog devices and left to rot, forgotten” ...damned to obscurity until now.  This is the only “ritual” that I know of to exist, but “several more vile raptures are forthcoming”.  -U.M.(01/09)"

“Notus Inlatinus creates anti-christian satanic art exclusively.  No thanks to anyone, to hell with all.  Do not contact us, we are deaf to your words.  Infernal Hails to Unrepentant Music for conspiring with us to spew our inextricable  hate for life and religion into this sick world”  -L.N.&G.P.
